stories.text:
I have an on-going personal project to host an off-grid server from my van. I have a few Raspberry Pis that I'm going to use, and as it stands I've assembled two of them into a K3s cluster.

My reasoning behind using Kubernetes is that I want something that supervises the server and makes sure everything stays healthy, and I also want to stay familiar with modern technology. In addition, I'd like to make it as easy as possible to add more computing power to the setup and I've found K3s tools that seem to do a good job of that.

My main question is: Am I over-engineering this setup? If so, what should I be using instead? If not, are there any tips and tricks that people have to make the most of this kind of setup? I know I'm not the first person to set up a home server on RPis, but I imagine most people aren't trying to take it off-grid for extended periods.
stories.title: Ask HN: What are the best tools for setting up a local RPi cluster?
